Casino Pest Control

Once you get your Coin Case , the casino is yours to conquer! If you try to use the slot machines, an occasional pest appears to bother you and the other patrons.
Porygon and its evolved forms are adept at using cyberspace to their advantage. This gives them an edge when gambling at the slots! Normally they are banned from the casino, but somehow they're finding their way past security. In this optional side quest, you will search for the source of these pests and make sure they never come back!
If you interact with one of these Porygon , it will scurry away, encoding itself into cyberspace to travel through the casino's computer network, popping out at a different slot machine.
Though the Porygon show up from the beginning of the game, there's not much you can do other than battle them until you both obtain the Coin Case . and unlock the field move Spark in the Once you've done both, you can Spark the slot machines (using a compatible Pokemon in your party) to temporarily take them offline.
Once a machine is offline, Porygon will no longer travel to it. You can corner them into one last machine! And then...
On seeing that the Porygon has left the casino, the handyman chasing them has an idea for how to track them. Talk to him again after returning to the lobby. He'll equip you with a way to track the Porygon .
Hand the Casino Magnetite over to the Porygon .
Casino Magnetite in place, Spark away all of the slot machines again. When you're ready to follow the Porygon , equip yourself with a battle-ready party that has at least one Pokemon that can learn Teleport . Head outside and use the Casino Lodestone .
Now you're in someone's living room? Unsurprisingly, they're not thrilled by your intrusion. Time for a double battle!

Once you defeat them, they'll make a weak attempt to enroll you in their scam. These two have installed a security vulnerability into the casino's network which allows Porygon to travel there in spite of any firewalls! Porygon infiltrates the casino, uses its computational advantages to make a killing, and then returns with profit in exchange for an Up-Grade . It's quite a tale. Better to not get involved.
If you fail to defeat these trainers, on the other hand, they'll still try to recruit you, but then they'll unceremoniously kick you out.
If you did defeat the trainers, then you can hang around in their apartment. Before you leave and figure out where you actually are, make sure to retrieve the Casino Magnetite . If you're feeling nice, you can offer the Porygon the Up-Grade that's conveniently on the table. It will be very happy if you do!
This will salvage your reputation a bit, after you've invaded someone's home. But the Porygon will also accept a few other items as an offering.
  • Nugget
  • Magnet
  • Magnet Ball
  • Electric Gem
  • Normal Gem
You can also get the Casino Magnetite back from the Porygon by attacking it, catching it, or scaring it so it runs away.
Once you have everything you need, leave the apartment. The door locks behind you - even if you did consider joining the scheme, this should tell you that it wasn't a genuine offer. It seems like they have some kind of exit strategy, and they're using it. Head back to the casino to report what you've found and to return the Casino Magnetite and Casino Lodestone .
Head back to the casino and... what the heck is going on?
When the schemers cut and run, something went wrong. Or maybe this was part of their plan. Who knows. Whatever the case, battle the two Porygon-Z and free the handyman. It's time to search for the device that keeps the network open. Head upstairs to the third and fourth floors. The handyman will let you into any locked rooms. There will be a few more wild Porygon-Z double battles on the way up.
On the third and fourth floors, the Porygon-Z you see are more aggressive and will attack you on sight. If they see you, they will launch a preemptive strike, so be careful and use Psychic Terrain to stop the preemptive strikes if they're wearing your party down too much. You can enter all of the rooms, but your destination is the room on the bottom right of the fourth floor.
The Porygon-Z wandering around this room are a pretty good sign that you're in the right place! The one guarding the PC is extra suspicious. Prepare for a totem battle!

Hyper Beam
Battle won, search the PC and this time there is something there! After retrieving it, all the Porygon will disappear from the casino. Your quest is over! The handyman will ask you to return the Casino Lodestone and Casino Magnetite . You can refuse, but there's no incentive to do so - these items won't do anything anymore. And if you do return them, you'll receive a sizeable chunk of coins as a reward (though you will receive fewer if you were unable to retrieve the Casino Magnetite ). Great work!
